titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Stutt Papers
titlestmt.author: Joshua Hauck-Whealton

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user Josh Hauck-Whealton.
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: A small collection of reports created by GE Engineer Charles (C.A.) Stutt, mostly related to his work in radio communications and radar.

note.p: Creation of this finding aid was supported by a grant from the Center for History of Physics, American Institute of Physics.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

bioghist.p: Charles Adolphus Stutt (1922-2013) received his doctorate in electrical engineering from MIT in 1950. He began working for the research laboratory at General Electric in 1957, specializing in statistical theory of communications. He managed a program in signal processing and communications until his retirement in 1985.

controlaccess.corpname: General Electric Company. Research and Development Center

scopecontent.p: This small collection contains GE R&D papers and reports written by Stutt. It also contains a set of drafting tools.

userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the miSci Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Archives.
